Title: Jigawa’s Auyo lacks bills due to poor attendance, not bribery – Reps deputy spokesman
Summary: Jigawa’s Auyo lacks bills due to poor attendance, not bribery – Reps deputy spokesman . Philip Agbese has dismissed allegations that lawmakers must pay between ₦1 million and $3 million to present motions, bills or petitions in the chamber .

Title: British Airways offloads 58 Abuja-London passengers over faulty door
Summary: A faulty aircraft door on a British Airways flight from Abuja to London resulted in 58 passengers being denied boarding . 58 passengers were denied boarding on Friday . British Airways offloads 58 Abuja-London passengers over faulty door .

Title: CFA’s women in investment management scholarship closes Monday
Summary: The CFA Society Nigeria has announced that applications for its 2025/2026 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Women in Investment Management (WIM) Scholarship will close on Monday, August 18, 2025 . The scholarship offers partial funding to cover 75% of exam fees .

Title: Nigeria’s new malaria vaccine cuts costs, crowds, caregiver fatigue in Kebbi
Summary: Nigeria’s new malaria vaccine shows early promise in Kebbi State, delivering both a significant reduction in childhood cases, as well as relief for health workers and families alike .

Title: FT Africa Summit 2025 to address Africa’s strategy amid trade, policy shifts
Summary: The Financial Times confirmed that its 12th FT Africa Summit will take place on 21–22 October 2025 at The Peninsula, London, with a focus on Africa’s strategy amid trade, policy shifts .

Title: Best Crypto Casinos: 5 Best Bitcoin Casino Sites To Gamble Online in August 2025
Summary: Crypto casinos have grown from niche platforms into some of the most popular destinations for online gambling . The appeal is easy to understand: payments move quickly, fees are low, and transactions are secured by blockchain technology .

Title: Civil Service to be fully digitized by December — FG
Summary: Nigeria's civil service will be completely digitalized by the end of this year . The Federal Government has declared that Nigeria’s civil service to be fully digitized by December .

Title: Tinubu has achieved so much, he’ll do more in two years, beyond – Idris
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has achieved so much, he’ll do more in two years, beyond – Idris . Minister of Information and National Orientation, Alhaji Mohammed Idris, says he has done remarkably well within two years of his administration .

Title: Taliban mark fourth year in power in Afghanistan
Summary: Afghanistan's Taliban authorities mark the fourth anniversary of their takeover on Friday . Russia's first official recognition of their government is a step they hope other countries will follow .

Title: EFCC arrests five suspected illegal miners in Uyo
Summary: EFCC arrests five suspected illegal miners in Uyo, Akwa Ibom . They were involved in the extraction and transportation of ilmenite, locally known as ‘black sand’ without the requisite license .

Title: Veteran Nollywood actor Chief Kanran is dead
Summary: Veteran Nollywood actor Olusegun Akinremi, popularly known as Chief Kanran, has died at the age of 70 . Movie executive and producer Seun Oloketuyi confirmed the news in an Instagram post on Friday, stating that the actor passed away earlier in the day . He was a household name in the Yor

Title: More investments needed to stabilise gas supply, NLNG tells NNPC boss
Summary: Nigeria LNG Limited’s Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, Philip Mshelbila, told Bayo Ojulari of the urgent need to invest in the gas sector to stabilise gas supply nationwide . He said there is “an urgent need for deliberate investment in the . gas sector . These efforts would be essential

Title: ‎‎FG begins talks with health unions, unveils bargaining committee
Summary: The Federal Government on Friday inaugurated the committee on collective bargaining for the health sector . The negotiations will involve structured engagements with the Nigerian Medical Association, the Joint Health Sector Union, the National Association of Nigerian Nurses and Midwives, and other health unions . This development comes days after the NMA issued a fresh 21-day ultim

Title: FG adopts menstrual health policy to combat stigma, boost girls' education
Summary: The Federal Government has adopted its first National Policy on Menstrual Health and Hygiene Management, aimed at improving the health, dignity, and opportunities of women and girls in Nigeria . The policy, funded by WaterAid Nigeria, with the support of Population Services International, was validated on Friday, in Abuja by the Minister of Women Affairs

Title: INEC includes SDP candidates in Saturday’s by-elections
Summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission has announced the inclusion of Social Democratic Party candidates in the by-elections scheduled to hold across 12 states on Saturday, August 16, 2025 . This decision followed a Federal High Court judgment mandating the Commission to recognise the party’s participation .
